newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yahoo! Japan says preparing OTC registration.
newsitem.headline: Yahoo! Japan says preparing OTC registration.

text.p: Yahoo! Japan Corp, a Japanese-language Internet search service company, said on Monday that it was preparing to register its shares on Japan's over-the-counter (OTC) market.

"We are preparing to register our shares on the over-the-counter market, but we cannot predict when the listing will be as that should be decided by an industry body," a company official said. "We hope to register as early as possible."
The official could not confirm a report in Monday's financial daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun which said the firm plans to register its shares in the summer.
The company had initially intended to register its shares on the second section of the OTC market, which was set up in July 1995 to make it easier for start-up companies to raise funds.
But after enjoying steady business earnings Yahoo! Japan is now seeking registration on the main OTC market, the official said.
Yahoo! Japan is a joint venture between Yahoo! Inc, a U.S.-based Internet search provider, and Japanese software publisher Softbank Corp.
It started offering its service in Japan last April.
